page.title: 03FARMING
page.content: FARMING MUCH OF THE LAND IS USED FOR FARMING. THERE ARE SEVERAL MIXED FARMS- BUT MANY OF THE SMALL FARMS HAVE BECOME UNECONOMIC BECAUSE OF THE HIGH COST OF MACHINERY. FARM HOUSES HAVE BEEN SOLD FOR DWELLING HOUSES AND THE LAND RENTED TO THE LARGER FARMERS FOR FOOD CROPS, GRAZING AND SILAGE. THE LAND IN THE WHARFE VALLEY IS USED FOR GROWING WHEAT, THE STEEP HILLSIDE FOR SHEEP GRAZING AND THE HIGHEST LAND FOR EITHER WHEAT OR GRAZING. STOCKTON GRANGE AND MOORHILL FARMS. THESE ARE THE TWO LARGEST FARMS, A TOTAL ACREAGE OF 528 ACRES. THEY ARE FARMED BY ONE FARMER AND THREE FARM WORKERS, AND ARE MIXED FARMS WITH 900 EWES, 350 SOWS AND WHEAT GROWN AS A CROP.
